Package it.unimol.monopoly.app

Class Turn

java.lang.Object
it.unimol.monopoly.app.Turn
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Turn extends Object implements Serializable
Singleton that defines the Turn object. This class is important to allow both the change of turn during the game, and the saving of the match's state. It will have the methods of all the operations that are possible in a turn of a monopoly game.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Angelo Trotta
See Also:

      public void passThroughGO(Player player)
      It allows the player to pass through "GO", adding 500â‚¬ to his bank account.

    • endTurn

      public boolean endTurn(Player player)
      It allows the player to end their turn, passing their ID to the playerId variable.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who has to change turn.
      Returns:
      Always true, since the change of turn is always possible.

    • saveTurn

      public void saveTurn()
      It allows to save the turns state on file, so that when the match is resumed the order of them isn't changed.

    • loadTurn

      public static int loadTurn() throws FileNotFoundException
      It allows to load the turns state from file, to resume the match exactly from where it was interrupted.
      Returns:
      the value of playerId if the variable is successfully loaded, -1 otherwise.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - In case the save file is not found.
